ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin theoria, from Ancient Greek theōría (θεωρία, 'contemplation, speculation, a looking at, things looked at'), from theōreō 'look at, view, contemplate'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A well-substantiated explanation of some aspect of the natural world, based on a body of facts that have been repeatedly confirmed through observation and experiment. Or, a set of principles on which the practice of an activity is based.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对自然界某一方面的一种经过充分验证的解释，基于通过观察和实验反复证实的一系列事实。或指某项活动实践所依据的一套原则。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The theory of evolution is widely accepted in the scientific community.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 进化论在科学界被广泛接受。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A supposition or a system of ideas intended to explain something, especially one based on general principles independent of the thing to be explained. Often implying a less rigorous or unproven idea.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种假设或一套旨在解释某事的想法体系，特别是基于独立于所解释事物的一般原则。常暗示一种不那么严谨或未经证实的想法。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I have a theory about why the internet is so slow today.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 关于为什么今天的网络这么慢，我有个理论。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: in theory | the theory of [sth] vs practice
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A noun is a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The abstract knowledge, principles, or methods of a subject rather than the practical application of them.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某个学科的抽象知识、原则或方法，而非其实际应用。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In theory, the plan sounds perfect, but I wonder how it will work in practice.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 理论上，这个计划听起来很完美，但我不知道实践中会如何。

REGISTER: Formal and academic in its primary scientific sense, but also common in everyday speech for hypotheses or speculation.
